title: Peloton's stock opens 6.9% below its IPO price, and keeps falling
text: Peloton Interactive Inc.'s stock PTON, -8.46% got off to a weak start Thursday, as it opened 6.9% below the initial public offering price. The first trade was at $27.00 at 11:57 a.m. Eastern for 6.9 million shares, and has since declined further to trade down 8.3%. The IPO priced late Wednesday at $29, which was at the top of the expected range of $26 to $29. The seller of connected exercise machines and fitness classes offered 40 million shares in the IPO to raise $1.16 billion at a valuation of about $8 billion. The company went public at a time that the Renaissance IPO ETF IPO, -0.62% has lost 7.1% over the past three months and the S&P 500 SPX, -0.32% has gained 1.8%.
